alert.note: Alert for Logan County; Morgan County; Northeast Weld County; Phillips County; Sedgwick County; Washington County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Warning issued December 22 at 8:35PM MST until December 23 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Boulder
info.description: .A very cold airmass is in place over northeastern Colorado, and breezy winds will continue to cause dangerous wind chill. Snowfall has ended, but drifting and blowing snow will allow for snow covered and slick roads which will impact the morning commute. ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Dangerously cold wind chills ongoing. Wind chills as low as 45 below zero. * WHERE...The far northeast plains of Colorado, including northeast Weld, Morgan, Washington, Logan, Phillips and Sedgwick Counties. * WHEN...Until 11 AM MST Friday. * IMPACTS...The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: The combination of wind and cold temperatures will create dangerously low wind chill values. Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves.

area.areaDesc: Logan County; Morgan County; Northeast Weld County; Phillips County; Sedgwick County; Washington County
